Description: Terracotta cooking stove fragment. A pot-support broken from a cooking-stove: the support itself is plain and rounded and does not project greatly within the fire-bowl. Above it is a plain round-topped panel rising from the inner edge of the everted rim and supported by three vertical ribs at the rear. The support and panel were handmodelled, the bowl wheel-made. Micaceous brown Nile silt with a buff-brown surface and a red and grey core; some white grits. Traces of plaster on the back.
Curator's comments: Published (Şahin 2001: 123, figs 123 and 124: Na 15). Şahin, M. 2001. Hellenistic braziers in the British Museum: Trade contacts between ancient Mediterranean cities. Anatolian Studies 51: 91-132.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3692)
Şahin 2001 / Hellenistic braziers in the British Museum: Trade contacts between ancient Mediterranean cities (p.123, figs 123 and 124: Na 15.)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (LA.36) (Phase 3)
